trans-unit.source: How to use CDN | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to use CDN | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the Azure Content Delivery Network (CDN) to deliver high-bandwidth content by caching blobs and static content.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the Azure Content Delivery Network (CDN) to deliver high-bandwidth content by caching blobs and static content.

trans-unit.source: Integrate a Storage Account with CDN
trans-unit.target: Integrate a Storage Account with CDN

trans-unit.source: CDN can be enabled to cache content from your Azure storage.
trans-unit.target: CDN can be enabled to cache content from your Azure storage.

trans-unit.source: It offers developers a global solution for delivering high-bandwidth content by caching blobs and static content of compute instances at physical nodes in the United States, Europe, Asia, Australia and South America.
trans-unit.target: It offers developers a global solution for delivering high-bandwidth content by caching blobs and static content of compute instances at physical nodes in the United States, Europe, Asia, Australia and South America.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Create a storage account
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Create a storage account

trans-unit.source: Use the following procedure to create a new storage account for a
trans-unit.target: Use the following procedure to create a new storage account for a

trans-unit.source: Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: A storage account gives access to
trans-unit.target: A storage account gives access to

trans-unit.source: Azure storage services.
trans-unit.target: Azure storage services.

trans-unit.source: The storage account represents the highest level
trans-unit.target: The storage account represents the highest level

trans-unit.source: of the namespace for accessing each of the Azure storage service
trans-unit.target: of the namespace for accessing each of the Azure storage service

trans-unit.source: components: Blob services, Queue services, and Table services.
trans-unit.target: components: Blob services, Queue services, and Table services.

trans-unit.source: For more
trans-unit.target: For more

trans-unit.source: information about the Azure storage services, see [Using the Azure Storage Services](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/gg433040.aspx).
trans-unit.target: information about the Azure storage services, see [Using the Azure Storage Services](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/gg433040.aspx).

trans-unit.source: To create a storage account, you must be either the service
trans-unit.target: To create a storage account, you must be either the service

trans-unit.source: administrator or a co-administrator for the associated subscription.
trans-unit.target: administrator or a co-administrator for the associated subscription.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] For information about performing this operation by using the
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] For information about performing this operation by using the

trans-unit.source: Azure Service Management API, see the [Create Storage Account](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/hh264518.aspx) reference topic.
trans-unit.target: Azure Service Management API, see the [Create Storage Account](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/hh264518.aspx) reference topic.

trans-unit.source: To create a storage account for an Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: To create a storage account for an Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure Management Portal].
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure Management Portal].

trans-unit.source: In the lower left corner, select **New**.
trans-unit.target: In the lower left corner, select **New**.

trans-unit.source: In the **New** Dialog, select **Data Services**, then click **Storage**, then **Quick Create**.
trans-unit.target: In the **New** Dialog, select **Data Services**, then click **Storage**, then **Quick Create**.

trans-unit.source: The **Create Storage Account** dialog appears.
trans-unit.target: The **Create Storage Account** dialog appears.

trans-unit.source: Create Storage Account
trans-unit.target: Create Storage Account

trans-unit.source: In the **URL** field, type a subdomain name.
trans-unit.target: In the **URL** field, type a subdomain name.

trans-unit.source: This entry can contain from 3-24 lowercase letters and numbers.
trans-unit.target: This entry can contain from 3-24 lowercase letters and numbers.

trans-unit.source: This value becomes the host name within the URI that is used to
trans-unit.target: This value becomes the host name within the URI that is used to

trans-unit.source: address Blob, Queue, or Table resources for the subscription.
trans-unit.target: address Blob, Queue, or Table resources for the subscription.

trans-unit.source: To
trans-unit.target: To

trans-unit.source: address a container resource in the Blob service, you would use a
trans-unit.target: address a container resource in the Blob service, you would use a

trans-unit.source: URI in the following format, where *<StorageAccountLabel>* refers
trans-unit.target: URI in the following format, where *<StorageAccountLabel>* refers

trans-unit.source: to the value you typed in **Enter a URL**:
trans-unit.target: to the value you typed in **Enter a URL**:

trans-unit.source: http://*<StorageAcountLabel>*.blob.core.windows.net/*<mycontainer>*
trans-unit.target: http://*<StorageAcountLabel>*.blob.core.windows.net/*<mycontainer>*

trans-unit.source: **Important:** The URL label forms the subdomain of the storage
trans-unit.target: **Important:** The URL label forms the subdomain of the storage

trans-unit.source: account URI and must be unique among all hosted services in
trans-unit.target: account URI and must be unique among all hosted services in

trans-unit.source: Azure.
trans-unit.target: Azure.

trans-unit.source: This value is also used as the name of this storage account in the portal, or when accessing this account programmatically.
trans-unit.target: This value is also used as the name of this storage account in the portal, or when accessing this account programmatically.

trans-unit.source: From the **Region/Affinity Group** drop-down list, select a region or affinity group for the storage account.
trans-unit.target: From the **Region/Affinity Group** drop-down list, select a region or affinity group for the storage account.

trans-unit.source: Select an affinity group instead of a region if you want your storage services to be in the same data center with other Microsoft Azure services that you are using.
trans-unit.target: Select an affinity group instead of a region if you want your storage services to be in the same data center with other Microsoft Azure services that you are using.

trans-unit.source: This can improve performance, and no charges are incurred for egress.
trans-unit.target: This can improve performance, and no charges are incurred for egress.

trans-unit.source: **Note:** To create an affinity group, open the **Settings** area of the Management Portal, click **Affinity Groups**, and then click either **Add an affinity group** or **Add**.
trans-unit.target: **Note:** To create an affinity group, open the **Settings** area of the Management Portal, click **Affinity Groups**, and then click either **Add an affinity group** or **Add**.

trans-unit.source: You can also create and manage affinity groups using the Microsoft Azure Service Management API.
trans-unit.target: You can also create and manage affinity groups using the Microsoft Azure Service Management API.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Operations on Affinity Groups].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Operations on Affinity Groups].

trans-unit.source: From the **Subscription** drop-down list, select the subscription that the storage account will be used with.
trans-unit.target: From the **Subscription** drop-down list, select the subscription that the storage account will be used with.

trans-unit.source: Click **Create Storage Account**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create Storage Account**.

trans-unit.source: The process of creating the storage account might take several minutes to complete.
trans-unit.target: The process of creating the storage account might take several minutes to complete.

trans-unit.source: To verify that the storage account was created successfully, verify that the account appears in the items listed for **Storage** with a status of **Online**.
trans-unit.target: To verify that the storage account was created successfully, verify that the account appears in the items listed for **Storage** with a status of **Online**.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Create a new CDN endpoint for your storage account
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Create a new CDN endpoint for your storage account

trans-unit.source: Once you enable CDN access to a storage account or hosted service, all
trans-unit.target: Once you enable CDN access to a storage account or hosted service, all

trans-unit.source: publicly available objects are eligible for CDN edge caching.
trans-unit.target: publicly available objects are eligible for CDN edge caching.

trans-unit.source: If you
trans-unit.target: If you

trans-unit.source: modify an object that is currently cached in the CDN, the new content
trans-unit.target: modify an object that is currently cached in the CDN, the new content

trans-unit.source: will not be available via the CDN until the CDN refreshes its content
trans-unit.target: will not be available via the CDN until the CDN refreshes its content

trans-unit.source: when the cached content time-to-live period expires.
trans-unit.target: when the cached content time-to-live period expires.

trans-unit.source: To create a new CDN endpoint for your storage account
trans-unit.target: To create a new CDN endpoint for your storage account

trans-unit.source: In the [Azure Management Portal], in the navigation pane, click **CDN**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Azure Management Portal], in the navigation pane, click **CDN**.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click **New**.
trans-unit.target: On the ribbon, click **New**.

trans-unit.source: In the **New** dialog, select **App Services**, then **CDN**, then **Quick Create**.
trans-unit.target: In the **New** dialog, select **App Services**, then **CDN**, then **Quick Create**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Origin Domain** dropdown, select the storage account you created in the previous section from the list of your available storage accounts.
trans-unit.target: In the **Origin Domain** dropdown, select the storage account you created in the previous section from the list of your available storage accounts.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Create** button to create the new endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Create** button to create the new endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Once the endpoint is created, it appears in a list of endpoints for the subscription.
trans-unit.target: Once the endpoint is created, it appears in a list of endpoints for the subscription.

trans-unit.source: The list view shows the URL to use to access cached content, as well as the origin domain.
trans-unit.target: The list view shows the URL to use to access cached content, as well as the origin domain.

trans-unit.source: The origin domain is the location from which the CDN caches
trans-unit.target: The origin domain is the location from which the CDN caches

trans-unit.source: content.
trans-unit.target: content.

trans-unit.source: The origin domain can be either a storage account or a cloud service; a storage account is used for the purposes of this example.
trans-unit.target: The origin domain can be either a storage account or a cloud service; a storage account is used for the purposes of this example.

trans-unit.source: Storage content is cached to edge servers according either to a cache-control setting that you specify, or to the default heuristics of the caching network.
trans-unit.target: Storage content is cached to edge servers according either to a cache-control setting that you specify, or to the default heuristics of the caching network.

trans-unit.source: See [How to Manage Expiration of Blob Content](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/gg680306.aspx) for more information.
trans-unit.target: See [How to Manage Expiration of Blob Content](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/gg680306.aspx) for more information.

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Access CDN content
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Access CDN content

trans-unit.source: To access cached content on the CDN, use the CDN URL provided in the portal.
trans-unit.target: To access cached content on the CDN, use the CDN URL provided in the portal.

trans-unit.source: The address for a cached blob will be similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: The address for a cached blob will be similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: http://<*CDNNamespace*\>.vo.msecnd.net/<*myPublicContainer*\>/<*BlobName*\>
trans-unit.target: http://<*CDNNamespace*\>.vo.msecnd.net/<*myPublicContainer*\>/<*BlobName*\>

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Remove content from the CDN
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Remove content from the CDN

trans-unit.source: If you no longer wish to cache an object in the Azure Content
trans-unit.target: If you no longer wish to cache an object in the Azure Content

trans-unit.source: Delivery Network (CDN), you can take one of the following steps:
trans-unit.target: Delivery Network (CDN), you can take one of the following steps:

trans-unit.source: You can make the container private instead of public.
trans-unit.target: You can make the container private instead of public.

trans-unit.source: See [Restrict Access to Containers and Blobs](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dd179354.aspx) for more information.
trans-unit.target: See [Restrict Access to Containers and Blobs](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dd179354.aspx) for more information.

trans-unit.source: You can disable or delete the CDN endpoint using the Management
trans-unit.target: You can disable or delete the CDN endpoint using the Management

trans-unit.source: Portal.
trans-unit.target: Portal.

trans-unit.source: You can modify your hosted service to no longer respond to requests for the
trans-unit.target: You can modify your hosted service to no longer respond to requests for the

trans-unit.source: object.
trans-unit.target: object.

trans-unit.source: An object already cached in the CDN will remain cached until the
trans-unit.target: An object already cached in the CDN will remain cached until the

trans-unit.source: time-to-live period for the object expires.
trans-unit.target: time-to-live period for the object expires.

trans-unit.source: When the time-to-live period
trans-unit.target: When the time-to-live period

trans-unit.source: expires, the CDN will check to see whether the CDN endpoint is still
trans-unit.target: expires, the CDN will check to see whether the CDN endpoint is still

trans-unit.source: valid and the object still anonymously accessible.
trans-unit.target: valid and the object still anonymously accessible.

trans-unit.source: If it is not, then
trans-unit.target: If it is not, then

trans-unit.source: the object will no longer be cached.
trans-unit.target: the object will no longer be cached.

trans-unit.source: The ability to immediately purge content is currently not supported on Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: The ability to immediately purge content is currently not supported on Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Please contact [Azure support](http://azure.microsoft.com/support/options/) if you need to immediately purge content.
trans-unit.target: Please contact [Azure support](http://azure.microsoft.com/support/options/) if you need to immediately purge content.
